title: Grilled Open-face Ham, Brie, and Arugula Sandwiches
summary: One serving contains 209 calories, 11g of protein, and 12g of fat. This recipe serves 20 and costs 86 cents per serving. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. A mixture of arugula, juice of lemon, ham, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 20 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 31%, this dish is rather bad. Try Open-Face Turkey, Brie, and Nectarine Sandwiches with Arugula Salad, Open-Face Grilled Eggplant Sandwiches, and Open-Face Grilled Eggplant Sandwiches for similar recipes.
instructions: Put 1/4 cup olive oil, the lemon juice and zest, garlic, sugar, and salt and pepper to taste in a blender and pulse to combine.                                                                                                 Preheat a gas or charcoal grill to medium (you can hold your hand 1 to 2 in. above cooking grate only 4 to 5 seconds). Brush oil on both sides of bread and put on grill; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill 2 minutes. Turn over, top with cheese, close lid, and grill until cheese melts, 1 to 2 minutes.                                                                                                 Top cheese evenly with ham. In a large bowl, toss arugula with vinaigrette and arrange a handful on each sandwich. Drizzle remaining vinaigrette over sandwiches.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per sandwich.

steps.step: Put 1/4 cup olive oil, the lemon juice and zest, garlic, sugar, and salt and pepper to taste in a blender and pulse to combine.
Preheat a gas or charcoal grill to medium (you can hold your hand 1 to 2 in. above cooking grate only 4 to 5 seconds).
Brush oil on both sides of bread and put on grill; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill 2 minutes. Turn over, top with cheese, close lid, and grill until cheese melts, 1 to 2 minutes.
Top cheese evenly with ham. In a large bowl, toss arugula with vinaigrette and arrange a handful on each sandwich.
